Its tentacles move with uncanny grace and seem capable of sending you hurtling through the air. |} [[Category:Templates]] ==Useful Info== '''Octopode crushers''' are deadlier than their common [[octopode (monster)|octopode]] brethren, both physically and magically. Along with their proficiency with [[Earth Magic]], they are capable of throwing anything they are currently [[constriction|constricting]] to a non-adjacent location for 1d64 damage (40% chance of this occurring each turn of constriction). They prefer to throw the player to a location near dangerous monsters or into open space. Octopode crushers can be found in watery portions of [[the Depths]] and rarely in [[vault]]s occurring in [[Shoals]]. ==Spells== [[Category:Spellcaster]]

==Tips & Tricks== *Getting thrown can change your position dramatically, possibly exposing you to unexplored areas and alerting further monsters. Furthermore, the potential 64 throw damage can leave you in a vulnerable state. You'll always be thrown somewhere that's safe to inhabit and that is currently within your [[line of sight]], so it's a good idea to fall back and melee a crusher from a position where most or all of the locations you can see are free of monsters and not near unexplored areas. *If your surroundings are very dangerous, try to kill or severely wound them at range. Crushers have only modest durability, and they can only throw you while you're constricted. *Crushers often carry [[shield]]s, so they'll occasionally block your targeted, ranged attacks; if you're a caster, it's much more effective to use unavoidable area attacks (eg, [[Fireball]], [[Freezing Cloud]]). ==History== Octopode crushers were removed in [[0.18]]. Prior to [[0.15]], they had only 14 HD and knew [[Throw Icicle]] instead of Iron Shot. Octopode crushers were added in [[0.14]].
